reviews.text: Very nice spot, with sea view when you come out, very nice
Beautiful cathedral ! We've had a good office with a welcoming priest
Hardly a cathedral. Dont go there
Nothing very special
Cool Place

This is a beautiful place to visit for the family in Chester.
The resident grey squirrels are unusually tame and will feed from your hand gladly.
The play area is new and in good order.
A miniature railway runs around a pond area.
There are statues and garden terraces with a spring water feature.

Great place to relax and watch the squirrels play. Nice view over the River Dee and meadows from the statue area. Good place to have a picnic. There's also the miniature railway that runs around the pond which is fun for kids and grown up kids.

A really peaceful and well kept park in the centre of Chester. Lots of wooden benches about to admire the scenery and squirrels - lots of grey squirrels! Even though it was a chilly boxing day morning, it was a joy to walk around with the knobbly trees and evergreen bushes. Lovely place :)

Grosvenor Park is Chester's principal city centre park situated outside the city walls next to the River Dee. Grounds are immaculately kept and are tended with colourful flower beds throughout the growing season.  The park is also home for species of mature trees. The park is used for seasonal exhibitions and shows including an annual outdoor theatre which has proven popular in recent years
Loved it.  Pretty gardens and lawns.  Info boards on the trees, cafes, sculptures,  play area, miniature railway. Squirrels can be hand fed! and all a short distance from the river and city centre
Fantastic walk. Full of history. No good for prams, wheelchairs  because you are walking the original wall. Beautiful views, you can exit the wall at various places for shops toilet etc.

A lovely little walk around the city walls in Chester. Think they're about 2.5 miles in total and take in tons and tons of history. You can see the racecourse that used to be a bustling port, the Shropshire Grand Union Canal, River Dee, the Cathedral, the Castle and lots of other Roman bits.
Excellent way to discover Chester! Easy access on and off at various points. Lots of historical information along the way.

Loved walking around the walls. Not continuous and steps to go up and down.  Went to the Xmas market . Very easy park and ride. Easier and cheaper than trying to park in Chester. Fantastic medieval buildings in the town centre and lots of lovely cafes etc

Decided to venture to Chester city walls and wasn't disappointed -- not crowded despite nice sunny Saturday afternoon -- lovely area around the cathedral but didn't visit birds of prey display as not fond of them !!
Worth a visit to appreciate roman origins of Chester
Use to look better the display of flowers not as nice as before however it's still very good very nice day out at the park and all around the Romans gardens in ruins Ds
We visit the gardens on a regular basis when the weather is good
A nice stroll round the walls. The sense of history is palpable.

Interesting little outdoor museum with columns and mosaics set in a peaceful garden. While I was there a Roman guide was giving a talk about the legionary baths and how the hypocaust provided central heating for the Romans 2000 years ago. And then I saw where the medieval walls were breached by cannon fire during the Civil War. There's a real sense of Chester's many layers of history here. A lovely spot to take a break from the bustle of the city.

A Gorgeous place to come on a hot summer's day with its breathtaking elegant surroundings and tranquil scenery, this Roman Garden would of made Julius Caesar Proud. A cute mini railway that runs around the park with tall trees that have stood tall for centuries. Some pleasant little ice-cream booths as well that make your mouth water with there mint choc-chip or honeycomb and ginger selection. A place to unwind and reflect afder a active days shopping. Highly recommend this true garden of Eden to anyone.

Popped in for a drink. This place had barely anything special about it. It was way too dark in every area we sat in, I had to turn my phone torch on to even see the menu. The roof terrace was pitch black, lights and heaters were out of order yet it was still open to the public. Not a huge fan.
Had a great night here this Friday. Local band The Swillers were playing and the place was bouncing. Lots of great ales and friendly doormen.
Nice place. Well trained staff who are welcoming.could do with a bit more atmosphere though. Overall a nice pub
Good choice of beer. Average prices for chester. Friendly staff and decent food. Really interesting (very) old building. Worth a visit if your in Chester.
The pub is quite dark inside however the food was nice and arrived quickly.  Had the fish and chips, very filling, it was served with bread and butter and scampi on the side.
Booked for a table of 20 for a hen do. The food was amazing!! And the service was great too. Highly recommended. Email contact was prompt to sort details. Thanks
Good food and a great cooking experience as they cook in front of you. Quite exhilarating.
Awesome food, good fun if you have teppanyaki. Great service, reasonably priced too. I'm definitely going back next time I'm in Chester!
Very yummy menu, good quality and not too expensive. Good vibe and attentive waiting staff.
Excellent and authentic food! Nice ambience and good staff. Would highly recommend.

My wife and I both had a mini portion of fish and chips for lunch. Portion size did seem a little small when it came out (but I guess the clue is in the name) however we both felt full and satisfied at the end. Both fish and chips were freshly cooked and the price included a drink. Good stuff. We'll be back.

Lovely crisp, fluffy chips - we couldn’t eat all of them. Great value at £1.95 per portion.  The coffee was not good though. The staff was friendly and efficient, bringing food to the table and clearing empties.
Really lovely fish and chips worth paying that bit extra for . My food was cooked to order so I had a little wait. Well worth it!! Would definitely recommend

Tried a free sample of their chips, ended up sat inside enjoying a tasty fish and chips meal. Clean, modern, quick service when we visited. Only downside was due to the noise as it's quite basic in design and therefore every sound was bounced around the shell of the building.

Really nice food. You don't get many chips though for the price. That is my only issue. You also have to pay for sauces which, given the price of the items, you shouldn't have to pay for sauces. 

The sausage and chips are really nice though.

Popped in for a drink. This place had barely anything special about it. It was way too dark in every area we sat in, I had to turn my phone torch on to even see the menu. The roof terrace was pitch black, lights and heaters were out of order yet it was still open to the public. Not a huge fan.
Had a great night here this Friday. Local band The Swillers were playing and the place was bouncing. Lots of great ales and friendly doormen.
Nice place. Well trained staff who are welcoming.could do with a bit more atmosphere though. Overall a nice pub
Good choice of beer. Average prices for chester. Friendly staff and decent food. Really interesting (very) old building. Worth a visit if your in Chester.
The pub is quite dark inside however the food was nice and arrived quickly.  Had the fish and chips, very filling, it was served with bread and butter and scampi on the side.
